learning_outcomes.description: Integrate and apply OHS knowledge within a work environment.
Acquire high level skills that will enhance the application of existing knowledge.
Plan strategies to address and solve complex OHS issues and associated change management.
Demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with both workers, management, and other relevant stakeholders.
Develop a high level of competence in the application of OHS and related skills and practice.
Apply knowledge of ethics to OHS professional practice.
Appraise your own performance by reflective practice in order to achieve the best possible outcomes.

assessments.task_description: Students are to develop a learning contract in consultation with their supervisor that outlines the six OHS tasks that the student will undertake during the placement.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit an electronic copy through turnitin Course Blackboard page
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students are required to undertake a range of OHS tasks that demonstrate their ability to apply OHS theoretical knowledge and technical/non-technical skills in practice.  During the 240 hour placement students are to complete OHS tasks and submit six (6) of these tasks during the semester. For each task, students are required to complete the OHS Task Form and upload supporting evidence to turnitin.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit this assessment in turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The student's general work practices will be assessed by the host supervisor. See checklist in the assessment section in the course Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Host supervisor emails supervisor report to course coordinator
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students are required to write a reflection on the application of ethical values into OHS practice.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to submit this assessment in turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Host Organisation Orientation

Students will spend Week 1 orientating themselves to their host workplace, including the undertaking of compulsory induction programs and developing learning contract.


Learning outcomes: L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Host Organisation Orientation Students will spend Week 1 orientating themselves to their host workplace, including the undertaking of compulsory induction programs and developing learning contract.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 15(29 Jul - 03 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
OHS Activity

Students spend weeks 2-15 completing OHS tasks as outlined in their learning contract.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: OHS Activity Students spend weeks 2-15 completing OHS tasks as outlined in their learning contract.
